TypeSignature.Value: public class IntentSender : Java.Lang.Object, Android.OS.IParcelable, IDisposable
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit IntentSender extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.OS.IParcelable, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: A description of an Intent and target action to perform with it.

remarks.para: A description of an Intent and target action to perform with it. The returned object can be handed to other applications so that they can perform the action you described on your behalf at a later time.

By giving a IntentSender to another application, you are granting it the right to perform the operation you have specified as if the other application was yourself (with the same permissions and identity). As such, you should be careful about how you build the IntentSender: often, for example, the base Intent you supply will have the component name explicitly set to one of your own components, to ensure it is ultimately sent there and nowhere else.

A IntentSender itself is simply a reference to a token maintained by the system describing the original data used to retrieve it. This means that, even if its owning application's process is killed, the IntentSender itself will remain usable from other processes that have been given it. If the creating application later re-retrieves the same kind of IntentSender (same operation, same Intent action, data, categories, and components, and same flags), it will receive a IntentSender representing the same token if that is still valid.
Instances of this class can not be made directly, but rather must be created from an existing with .

Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

Docs.summary: Return the package name of the application that created this IntentSender, that is the identity under which you will actually be sending the Intent.

remarks.para: Return the package name of the application that created this IntentSender, that is the identity under which you will actually be sending the Intent. The returned string is supplied by the system, so that an application can not spoof its package.

Docs.summary: Return the uid of the application that created this PendingIntent, that is the identity under which you will actually be sending the Intent.

remarks.para: Return the uid of the application that created this PendingIntent, that is the identity under which you will actually be sending the Intent. The returned integer is supplied by the system, so that an application can not spoof its uid.

Docs.summary: Return the user handle of the application that created this PendingIntent, that is the user under which you will actually be sending the Intent.

remarks.para: Return the user handle of the application that created this PendingIntent, that is the user under which you will actually be sending the Intent. The returned UserHandle is supplied by the system, so that an application can not spoof its user. See for more explanation of user handles.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SendIntent (Android.Content.Context context, Android.App.Result code, Android.Content.Intent intent, Android.Content.IntentSender.IOnFinished onFinished, Android.OS.Handler handler);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SendIntent(class Android.Content.Context context, valuetype Android.App.Result code, class Android.Content.Intent intent, class Android.Content.IntentSender/IOnFinished onFinished, class Android.OS.Handler handler) cil managed

Docs.param: The Context of the caller. This may be null if intent is also null.
Result code to supply back to the IntentSender's target.
Additional Intent data. See for information on how this is applied to the original Intent. Use null to not modify the original Intent.
The object to call back on when the send has completed, or null for no callback.
Handler identifying the thread on which the callback should happen. If null, the callback will happen from the thread pool of the process.
Docs.summary: Perform the operation associated with this IntentSender, allowing the caller to specify information about the Intent to use and be notified when the send has completed.

remarks.para: Perform the operation associated with this IntentSender, allowing the caller to specify information about the Intent to use and be notified when the send has completed.

Docs.exception: Throws CanceledIntentException if the IntentSender is no longer allowing more intents to be sent through it.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SendIntent (Android.Content.Context context, Android.App.Result code, Android.Content.Intent intent, Android.Content.IntentSender.IOnFinished onFinished, Android.OS.Handler handler, string requiredPermission);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SendIntent(class Android.Content.Context context, valuetype Android.App.Result code, class Android.Content.Intent intent, class Android.Content.IntentSender/IOnFinished onFinished, class Android.OS.Handler handler, string requiredPermission) cil managed

Docs.param: The Context of the caller. This may be null if intent is also null.
Result code to supply back to the IntentSender's target.
Additional Intent data. See for information on how this is applied to the original Intent. Use null to not modify the original Intent.
The object to call back on when the send has completed, or null for no callback.
Handler identifying the thread on which the callback should happen. If null, the callback will happen from the thread pool of the process.

Name of permission that a recipient of the PendingIntent is required to hold. This is only valid for broadcast intents, and corresponds to the permission argument in . If null, no permission is required.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
